pr_title: 20w15a Mapping Fixes 2: The Jumping The Shark Update

timeline.bodyText: random is better than rand (and it's also used more in Yarn)
timeline.author: Juuxel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -337,7 +337,7 @@ CLASS net/minecraft/class_2248 net/minecraft/block/Block
 		ARG 1 state
 		ARG 2 world
 		ARG 3 pos
-		ARG 4 random
+		ARG 4 rand

timeline.bodyText: the json key in blockstate variant json is uvlock
timeline.author: liach

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		ARG 2 field
          
          
            
            		ARG 2 propertyId
timeline.author: liach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,9 +1,11 @@
 CLASS net/minecraft/class_1712 net/minecraft/screen/ScreenHandlerListener
 	METHOD method_7633 onPropertyUpdate (Lnet/minecraft/class_1703;II)V
 		ARG 1 handler
-		ARG 2 propertyId
+		ARG 2 field

replies.bodyText: Parameters are a field/value pair though. If you call it that, then we have to do propertyId/propertyValue and in that case, why not just make it id/value? It makes no sense.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: property/value would be fine IMO. Just id is a bit too vague.
replies.author: Juuxel

replies.bodyText: I can go with property / values then, if no one else objects.
replies.author: Sollace

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		ARG 1 schema
          
          
            
            		ARG 1 parent
timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Obviously this because it matches the params shown in DFU. Maybe we need someone to look over all the fixes and verify these have the right param names.
replies.author: i509VCB

replies.bodyText: Why though? The class name is very clearly Schema.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: So if you have a string parameter that serves as prefix, we'd rather name it prefix than string.
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText:
I'll rephrase it, then: what about this parameter makes you think it should be called parent? And if all the use cases of this class refers to it as parent, why is the class itself not called FixParent?
To me a parent means the parameter is itself the parent node in a tree, and/or the same, or a super-type of this, the child element.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText:
Hmm, I think this should actually be

  
    
  
    

  
  This file contains bidirectional Unicode text that may be interpreted or compiled differently than what appears below. To review, open the file in an editor that reveals hidden Unicode characters. Learn more about bidirectional Unicode characters


  


    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            		ARG 1 schema
          
          
            
            		ARG 1 outputSchema
          
      
    
    
  

forgot why i suggested parent before
replies.author: liach

timeline.message: Fill in missing names, fix questionable ones

timeline.author: liach

replies.bodyText: Other screens should be changed, then. This texture is used to draw the background of the screen.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: hmm, i suggest moving that to a separate pr
replies.author: liach

timeline.bodyText: Same, other screens use texture for now.
timeline.author: liach

timeline.bodyText: If you add Abstract to this screen, add Abstract to the handler as well.
timeline.author: liach
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1,10 +1,10 @@
-CLASS net/minecraft/class_4894 net/minecraft/client/gui/screen/ingame/ForgingScreen
-	FIELD field_22794 texture Lnet/minecraft/class_2960;
+CLASS net/minecraft/class_4894 net/minecraft/client/gui/screen/ingame/AbstractForgingScreen

replies.bodyText: I wouldn't change it unless the handler class was also abstract, imo.
replies.author: Sollace

replies.bodyText: maybe mojang just forgot to declare one of the classes abstract, who knows
replies.author: liach

replies.bodyText: So, what's the decision on this?
replies.author: YanisBft

replies.bodyText: Probably needs a vote. I personally see no need to declare this abstract, as calling this forging already conveys abstraction.
replies.author: liach
